column4: I'm trying to create an image of a 1TB hard drive. using both dd (with various bs settings) and partclone, they start fast and get continuously slower. why is this? how can i fix it?
monitor dmesg output as they work.. there could be some bad parts of the hd they are having to re-read
could you give me more detailed instructions please?
see what 'dmesg' says in the terminal when it slows down.
it is getting slower all the time
you saw no error messages in the dmesg logs?
whats the exact dd line you are using?
if you use the ddrescue command (or was it dd_rescue) with the logging option. it can start from whhere it left off also. :)
how big is that hd you are imageing anyway?
you are ysing a bs option also?
yes, here is the command "sudo dd bs=32M if=/dev/sdb of=./Windows_Backup.img"
i think 32 mb may be overkill i alwasy use like 1 mb. and check dmesg for errors as it runs. you may want to try ddrescue with a logfile also
what should i look for in dmesg
any mention of the hd you are imaging from.
here is the output of dmesg | grep sdb. http://pastebin.com/EBemj0tK
this is a external usb?
no sdb (the source) is an internal sata drive, sdc (destination drive) is the external usb
theres some reported bugs about very.slow.usb speeds. ive had similer.issues
is there a better program for imaging to a usb drive?
that wont help if its a kernel bug causeing it to be slow. try  ddrescue perhaps
what is the advantage of dd_rescue?
ddrescue us different from dd_rescue
